Lyrics: Esta é como ũa moura levou séu fillo mórto a Santa María de Salas, e ressucitou-llo.
Direct Translation: This is how a Moorish woman took her dead son to Holy Mary of Salas, and She revived him for her.

Lyrics: Quen quér que na Virgen fía | e a róga de femença,
Direct Translation: The Virgin will aid whoever trusts in Her and prays faithfully to Her,
Poetic Translation: Those who trust in the Virgin and ask her For her help will be helped. It is surely so,

Lyrics: valer-ll-á, pero que seja | d' outra lee en creença.
Direct Translation: although he be a follower of another law.
Poetic Translation: Even if their faith is foreign And a foreign law they follow.

Lyrics: Desta razôn fez miragre | Santa María, fremoso,
Direct Translation: Concerning this, Holy Mary of Salas performed
Poetic Translation: Here's a story that will prove it: What the Virgin did in Salas

Lyrics: de Salas, por ũa moura | de Borja, e pïadoso,
Direct Translation: a beautiful and merciful miracle for a Mooress from Borja
Poetic Translation: For a simply Moorish woman, Who from Borja bore a great cross.

Lyrics: ca un fillo que avía, | que crïava, mui viçoso,
Direct Translation: because a beautiful child she had and cared for
Poetic Translation: She was mother to a son, whom She loved dearly and then she lost.

Lyrics: lle morrera mui coitado | dũa mui fórte doença.
Direct Translation: had died pitifully from a very serious disease.
Poetic Translation: He had died from a grave illness. She felt overwhelming sorrow.

Lyrics: Ela, con coita do fillo, | que fezésse non sabía,
Direct Translation: The woman, with grief for her son, did not know what to do.
Poetic Translation: This poor mother was distressed and Did not know what to do and was afraid,

Lyrics: e viu como as crischãas | ían a Santa María
Direct Translation: She saw how the Christians went to Holy Mary of Salas
Poetic Translation: But she saw how Christian women Went to Salas seeking Mary's aid,

Lyrics: de Salas, e dos miragres | oiu que ela fazía,
Direct Translation: and heard of the miracles She performed
Poetic Translation: And she knew of the miracles that Mary granted when the women prayed.

Lyrics: e de fïar-se na Virgen | fillou mui grand' atrevença;
Direct Translation: and ventured to trust in the Virgin.
Poetic Translation: So she gathered up her courage And to Salas readied herself to go.

Lyrics: E comendou-ll' o meninno | e guisou sa oferenda.
Direct Translation: She commended the child to Her and prepared her offering.
Poetic Translation: She entrusted the child to the Virgin And gave an offering as best she might.

Lyrics: Mais las mouras sobr' aquesto | lle davan mui gran contenda;
Direct Translation: However, the Moorish women protested to her about this,
Poetic Translation: All her Moorish neighbors were outraged At this shocking and sacriligious sight.

Lyrics: mais ela lles diss': "Amigas, | se Déus me de mal defenda,
Direct Translation: but she told them: "Friends, if God protects me from harm,
Poetic Translation: But she said, "May God defend me, Friends, I must do what I think is right,

Lyrics: a mia esperança creo | que vóssa perfía vença.
Direct Translation: I believe that my hope will overcome your objections,
Poetic Translation: And I believe my faith is stronger Than your doubts, however large they grow.

Lyrics: Ca éu levarei méu fillo | a Salas desta vegada
Direct Translation: "for I shall take my son to Holy Mary of Salas right away,
Poetic Translation: "I will take my son to Salas; At this very moment, I leave.

Lyrics: con sa omagen de cera, | que ja lle tenno comprada,
Direct Translation: with this waxen image which I have bought for Her.
Poetic Translation: I will bring a waxen figure Of my son for the Virgin to receive.

Lyrics: e velarei na eigreja | da mui benaventurada
Direct Translation: I shall keep watch in the church of the most blessed Holy Mary,
Poetic Translation: I'll keep vigil in the church where Holy Mary watches while I grieve,

Lyrics: Santa María, e tenno | que de mia coita se sença."
Direct Translation: and I believe that She will sympathize with my woe."
Poetic Translation: And I'll pray that She takes pity On my neverending sorrow."

Lyrics: E moveu e foi-se lógo, | que non quis tardar nïente,
Direct Translation: She went at once, for she would not tarry,
Poetic Translation: And she went at once to Salas, And she did not waste any time at all

Lyrics: e levou séu fillo mórto, | maravillando-s' a gente;
Direct Translation: and carried her dead son, to the people's great amazement.
Poetic Translation: Carrying her little son there, Though her friends were certainly appalled.

Lyrics: e pois que chegou a Salas, | diss' aa Virgen: "Se non mente
Direct Translation: When she arrived at Salas, she said to the Virgin: "If your law
Poetic Translation: Entering the town of Salas, To the Virgin crying out she called,

Lyrics: ta lee, dá-me méu fillo, | e farei tig' avẽença."
Direct Translation: does not lie, give me my son, and I will make my peace with you."
Poetic Translation: "If this faith is real, return him, And I will serve You wherever I go."

Lyrics: Ũa noite tod' enteira | velou assí a mesquinna;
Direct Translation: Thus the poor woman kept watch a whole night through,
Poetic Translation: All night long she kept her vigil With the mercy of Mary in view.

Lyrics: mas, que fez Santa María, | a pïadosa Reínna?
Direct Translation: and what did Holy Mary, the Merciful Queen, do?
Poetic Translation: And what then did Holy Mary, Queen of Heaven, decide to do?

Lyrics: ressucitou-lle séu fillo, | e esto foi muit' aginna;
Direct Translation: She revived her son for her in a trice,
Poetic Translation: Mary resurrected the boy, and Did it without any delay, too,

Lyrics: ca a sa mui gran vertude | passa per toda sabença.
Direct Translation: for Her power surpasses understanding.
Poetic Translation: For Her great and holy power passes all that any of us can know.

Lyrics: Quand' aquesto viu a moura, | ouv' ên maravilla féra,
Direct Translation: When the Mooress saw this, she considered it a wondrous mircle,
Poetic Translation: When the mother saw this happen, She was overcome with amazement and joy,

Lyrics: ca ja tres días avía | que o fillo mórt' ouvéra;
Direct Translation: for her son had been dead for three days.
Poetic Translation: For it had been three lonely days since life had made its way through her boy.

Lyrics: e tornou lógo crischãa, | pois viu que llo vivo déra
Direct Translation: She at once became a Christian, for she saw that Holy Mary
Poetic Translation: Gratefully, she became a Christian And from then on all her days employed

Lyrics: Santa María e sempre | a ouv' en gran reverença.
Direct Translation: had given him back to her alive, and she always held Her in great reverence.
Poetic Translation: To serve God and serve the Virgin, her devotion every day to show.
